topic.title: [Help][Newbie] Linux question about networking!
topic.body: my wifi goes down sometimes and I was trying to figure out why and noticed that "systemd-networkd.service" - AND - "NetworkManager.service" (/etc/init.d/Network-Mananger) were both running at the same time and both active is this a problem? I thought maybe only 1 was supposed to be active from what I was trying to google it seemed like "pick one or the other"

1509044343_13cusqQkWAixH4fT8EtoARcWLcGgb.body:
> [jlxip](#comment_36_195Xafx3aZsxtngKo7D3XWgByQ5rYJX1C): I think I need more information.What distro are you running? Did you install any of those packages yourself?

I'm running TinkerOS (Debian Stretch base) it's for a tinkerboard SoC like Pi, I didn't install them I don't think the other things I installed were lighttpd and bind9

apparently they were not needed (only network-manager) I stopped "service networking" and "service systemd-networkd" and I still had connectivity to it via SSH and it's still serving my websites. I'll monitor further to make sure I don't see anything off in the logs. I just want to kill off everything that's not needed for the webserver which will bring me closer to catching any errors that take it offline like the networking issue
